qas.question: What are the  state schools in somerset

answers.text: Bath and North East Somerset, North Somerset, and the larger Somerset County Council

qas.question: What are the 3 tiers of school

answers.text: a three-tier system of first, middle and upper schools in the Cheddar Valley, and in West Somerset

qas.question: How many state and independent secondary  schools in Somerset

answers.text: Somerset has 30 state and 17 independent secondary schools

qas.question: What is the average class size in Somerset independent secondary schools?
What is the average class size in Somerset state secondary schools?
How many schools are in Cheddar Valley?
How many state secondary schools are there in Bath?
How many private secondary schools are there in North Somerset?

context: State schools in Somerset are provided by three local education authorities: <a0_0>Bath and North East Somerset, North Somerset, and the larger Somerset County Council<a0_0/>. All state schools are comprehensive. In some areas primary, infant and junior schools cater for ages four to eleven, after which the pupils move on to secondary schools. There is <a1_0>a three-tier system of first, middle and upper schools in the Cheddar Valley, and in West Somerset<a1_0/>, while most other schools in the county use the two-tier system. <a2_0>Somerset has <b4_0>30<b4_0/> state and <b3_0><b7_0>17<b7_0/><b3_0/> independent secondary schools<a2_0/>; Bath and North East Somerset has <b6_0>13<b6_0/> state and <b5_0>5<b5_0/> independent secondary schools; and North Somerset has 10 state and 2 independent secondary schools, excluding sixth form colleges.
